intro: Acranthera, commonly known as the starry bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Campanulaceae. These plants are characterized by their showy, bell-shaped flowers that often have a star-like appearance. Acranthera species are typically found in arid or semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained soils. They produce small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens.
